qas.question: What year was the National Archives Establishment established in?
In what year did NARA become an independent agency?
In what year was The National Archives merged with GSA?
Why did NARA establish the National Archives in 1934?

plausible_answers.text: the Archivist of the United States

qas.question: Who is the head of NARA?
What happened originally when the GSA was responsible for maintaining documents?
What was the chief administrator incorporated with in 1949?

context: Originally, each branch and agency of the U.S. government was responsible for maintaining its own documents, which often resulted in <b6_0>records loss and destruction<b6_0/>. Congress established the <b3_0>National Archives Establishment<b3_0/> in <a0_0>1934<a0_0/> <b4_0>to centralize federal record keeping<b4_0/>, with <b5_0>the Archivist of the United States<b5_0/> as chief administrator. The National Archives was incorporated with <b7_0>GSA<b7_0/> in <a2_0>1949<a2_0/>; in <a1_0>1985<a1_0/> it became an independent agency as NARA (National Archives and Records Administration).
